relation_pairs: Terminates the process in an abnormal fashion.
The function will never return and will immediately terminate the current process in a platform specific 'abnormal' manner.
Note that because this function never returns, no destructors on any thread's stack will be run.
Contrasts with panic! which unwinds the current thread's stack and calls destructors.
When 'panic=abort' is set, panic! and abort are similar but panic! still calls panic hook.
Representation of a running or exited child process.
A handle to a child process's stderr.
A handle to a child process's standard input (stdin).
A handle to a child process's standard output (stdout).
A process builder providing fine-grained control over process spawning.
Represents status code a process returns under normal termination.
Describes the result of a process after termination.
The output of a finished process.
Describes standard I/O stream handling for child processes.
A trait for implementing arbitrary return types in main function.
Terminates the current process with specified exit code.
